law.catch_line: The trustees have the power to:...

text.section: The provisions of this section do not authorize any sale, mortgage, or other disposition of any asset of the religious corporation which is held under an instrument prohibiting that sale, mortgage, or other disposition.

By resolution, the trustees may authorize one or more of their members to:
Execute any instrument required to be executed by the trustees, including any deed, mortgage, or other conveyance of assets which are to be sold, transferred, or encumbered; and
Attest and affix to the instrument the corporate seal, if any.
